chuck jaws.description: the movable jaws that grip the workpiece and hold it securely in place during turning

tools needed.carding comb: used to clean and align the fibers before they are spun into yarn
tools needed.distaff: a device used to hold the fiber being spun, usually consisting of a stick or a bowl with a flat base
tools needed.spindle whorl: a disc or sphere attached to the spindle shaft to help maintain the rotation speed and balance of the spindle
tools needed.spinning wheel: the main tool used for spinning yarn, which consists of a frame with a spindle rod and a flyer

spindle.description: a small, rotating object with a pointed end used for spinning fibers into yarn
spindle.name: spindle

related objects.distaff: a support for holding fiber while spinning

variants.drop spindle: has a weighted bottom that drops to create twist in the yarn
variants.great wheel: a large, communal spindle used by multiple spinners at once
variants.tourniquet spindle: uses a brake mechanism to control the speed of the rotation

bobbin.description: a cylinder-shaped container used to hold the yarn or thread as it is being spun

flyer.description: a small wheel that pulls the yarn or thread from the spindle and drafts it into a uniform strand

maiden.description: the base of the spinning wheel, providing stability and support for the spindle and flyer

spindle.description: a long, thin rod with a pointed tip used to twist fibers into yarn or thread

treadle.description: a lever that allows the user to adjust the speed of the whorl by changing the distance between the maiden and the flyer

whorl.description: the large, circular disk at the top of the spinning wheel that provides momentum for the spindle and flyer

tools needed.chisel: for shaping the wood if necessary, especially the spindle and flyer
tools needed.hammer: to drive the pins into the frame
tools needed.pliers: for holding small parts while assembling them
tools needed.vise: for holding the spinning wheel steady when working on it

spinning wheel.description: a tool used for spinning yarn or thread from fibers such as wool or cotton
spinning wheel.name: spinning wheel

related objects.drop spindle: a simple tool consisting of a wooden shaft and a weighted disk or ball at the bottom, used for spinning yarn by hand

variants.distaff and spindle: consisted of a staff or rod with a disc or hook on one end for holding the fiber, and a spindle on the other end for twisting the yarn
variants.great wheel: a large, communal spinning wheel that could be used by multiple people at once
variants.spinning jenny: a multi-headed machine that could spin multiple threads simultaneously
variants.treadle wheel: powered by a foot pedal instead of being hand-cranked

blade.description: the sharp edge of the sword used for cutting and striking

edge bevels.description: angled edges on either side of the blade that increase sharpness and cutting ability

fuller.description: a groove in the middle of the blade that reduces weight and increases flexibility

guard.description: a protective piece that covers the hilt and prevents the hand from slipping onto the blade

handle.description: the grip of the sword used for holding and controlling it

pommel.description: a rounded or bulbous piece at the end of the handle used as a counterweight to balance the sword

tools needed.file: to sharpen the sword blade
tools needed.hammer: to shape the blade if necessary and to drive the pommel onto the handle
tools needed.rasp: for shaping or smoothing the blade if necessary and removing any burrs or imperfections.
tools needed.vise: for holding the sword steady when working on it, but not strictly necessary

sword.description: a bladed weapon used for cutting or thrusting
sword.name: sword

related objects.dagger: a short, sharp blade used for stabbing
related objects.mace: a heavy club with a spiked head used for striking blows

variants.broad sword: has a wider blade for cutting through armor and shields
variants.ceremonial sword: is decorated with gold and jewels for ceremonial purposes
variants.dueling sword: is designed specifically for one-on-one combat
variants.long sword: has a longer blade for use in battle
variants.short sword: has a shorter blade for use in close combat

handle.description: a gripping surface for the user to hold onto while using the tongs

jaw.description: the movable section of the tongs used to grasp and manipulate the workpiece

spring.description: a coiled metal spring that provides tension and force to open or close the jaws

tools needed.hammer: to shape the metal and set the jaws
tools needed.pliers: for shaping and bending the metal to form the jaws of the tongs
tools needed.vise: for holding the tongs steady when working on them, but not strictly necessary

tongs.description: a tool used for grasping and manipulating hot metal
tongs.name: tongs

related objects.pincers: a pair of pliers used for gripping small objects

variants.chain tongs: has a chain link between the handles for better control over the movement of the metal
variants.crucible tongs: designed for handling molten metal in a crucible
variants.forging tongs: used for shaping hot metal by applying pressure with the jaws
variants.pliers-style tongs: resembles pincers and is used for gripping small objects while heating or cooling them

foot pedal.description: a lever that connects to the loom mechanism and is operated by the foot to advance the warp beam and weft rod

frame.description: the main structure of the loom that supports the warp beam and weaving mechanism

treadle frame.description: a separate frame with pedals used to operate the loom instead of a treadle attached to the frame

warp beam.description: a long, flat piece of wood or metal that holds the warp threads in place for weaving

weft rod.description: a narrow bar on which the weft thread is wound for easy insertion into the fabric during weaving

tools needed.hammer: to drive nails or pins into the wood frames and to secure any loose pieces
tools needed.needle and thread: for sewing the fabric onto the warp beam or for repairing any tears or damage to the weaving cloth
tools needed.pliers: for gripping and bending wires or metal rods used in the heddles or harnesses
tools needed.screwdriver: for tightening or adjusting screws in the loom frame and other mechanical parts

treadle loom.description: a device used for weaving fabric on a loom
treadle loom.name: treadle loom

related objects.shuttle: used for passing the weft thread through the warp threads
related objects.warping board: used for preparing the warp threads before weaving

variants.counterbalance treadle loom: has a system of weights and pulleys to balance the movement of the treadles
variants.jacquard treadle loom: has a mechanism that automatically selects which warp threads are raised or lowered based on a pattern
variants.pit treadle loom: operated by foot pedals in a pit below the level of the weaver's workspace
variants.tall treadle loom: designed for weaving wider fabrics with multiple sets of harnesses

blade.description: the long, narrow, sharp edge of the sword used for cutting and thrusting

crossguard.description: an additional barrier between the blade and the hand that provides extra protection during use

grip.description: a handle or hilt designed to be held comfortably in one hand while wielding the sword with the other

guard.description: a protective barrier between the hand and the blade that prevents injury during use

pommel.description: the end of the grip opposite the guard, often decorated with ornate designs or engravings

tools needed.file: to sharpen the sword blade if necessary and to remove any burrs or imperfections.
tools needed.hammer: to drive the pins into the hilt and secure the guard
tools needed.rasp: for shaping or smoothing the handle, especially if it doesn't fit the guard
tools needed.vise: for holding the sword steady when working on it, but not strictly necessary

two-handed sword.description: a long, heavy sword requiring both hands to wield effectively, designed for use by warriors in battle
two-handed sword.name: two-handed sword

related objects.battleaxe: a heavy axe with a long handle, used for striking blows in combat
related objects.longsword: a one-handed sword with a longer blade than a typical sword

variants.broad sword: has a wider blade for slashing attacks
variants.great sword: has an even longer blade and is heavier than a typical two-handed sword
variants.pikeman's sword: short and lightweight, designed for use with a pike in battle

back beam.description: the long, narrow piece of wood or metal on which the warp threads are wound

frame.description: the wooden or metal structure that supports the loom and provides tension for the warp threads

front beam.description: the shorter, wider piece of wood or metal that holds the heddles and harnesses

harnesses.description: a set of cords or wires connected to the heddle bars and used to raise and lower the sheds for weaving

heddle bars.description: the rectangular pieces of wood or metal with eyelets used to separate the warp threads for weaving

shuttle.description: a small, narrow device used to pass the weft thread through the shed

warping board.description: a flat surface used to wind the warp threads onto the back beam of the loom

tools needed.beater: a tool used to beat the fabric down after each row of weaving to ensure even tension
tools needed.bobbins: small, spindle-like objects used to store the weft thread before it is woven into the fabric
tools needed.heddles: a set of bars or frames with eyelets that hold the warp threads and allow them to be raised or lowered
tools needed.leashes: strings used to tie the warp threads to the heddles on the harness
tools needed.shuttle: a device used to weave the weft thread back and forth through the warp threads
tools needed.warping board: used for winding the warp threads onto the loom's beam or bar

vertical loom.description: a device used for weaving fabric by interlacing yarns or threads
vertical loom.name: vertical loom

related objects.horizontal loom: has the warp threads running horizontally

variants.countermarch loom: has two sets of harnesses that allow for more complex patterns
variants.jacquard loom: has a system of cards or punched tape to control the pattern of the weave
variants.treadle loom: has a pedal mechanism for raising and lowering the warp threads

base.description: a secure foundation to which the vice is anchored

jaws.description: the movable jaws used to grip the workpiece

screws.description: adjustment screws used to tighten or loosen the jaws

swivel.description: a pivot point allowing the jaws to rotate and adjust their angle

tools needed.chisel: to shape the wooden jaws and fit them around the metal vise screw
tools needed.file: to smooth any rough edges on the metal vise screw or the wooden jaws
tools needed.hammer: to drive the screws or pins into the wood block
tools needed.wooden mallet: for driving the screws or pins into the wood block to create the jaws of the vice

vice.description: a device used for holding the anvil steady during blacksmithing or metalworking
vice.name: vice

related objects.anvil: a heavy block of iron or steel on which metal is shaped by hammering

variants.machinist's vice: designed for holding metal parts in place during machining operations
variants.pipe vice: used for bending pipes and tubing to specific shapes
variants.wooden vice: made from wood and used for holding small pieces while carving or shaping them

base.description: a secure foundation to which the vise is anchored

jaws.description: the movable jaws used to grip the sword

pivot pin.description: a pivot point for the jaws, allowing them to move up and down

screws.description: adjustment screws used to tighten or loosen the jaws

tools needed.blacksmith's hammer: for shaping and fitting the jaws of the vise onto the handle
tools needed.chisel: to carve out the grooves for the screw mechanism
tools needed.lathe: for turning the wooden handle and shaping it to fit the vise head
tools needed.screwdriver: for tightening or loosening the screws that hold the jaws in place

vise.description: a device used for holding a sword steady while working on it
vise.name: vise

related objects.anvil: a heavy block of metal used for shaping metal or striking blows

variants.bench vise: designed to be mounted on a workbench
variants.machinist's vise: used in metalworking and machining industries
variants.post vise: mounted on a post or wall and can be adjusted in height

crossbar.description: a horizontal bar that spans the width of the frame and supports the weight of the warp threads

frame.description: the wooden frame that provides support for the warp threads

pegs.description: small holes in the frame used to secure the warp threads

ruler.description: a straightedge used to measure and mark the length of the warp threads

tools needed.chisels: for shaping the edges of the base and top pieces, if necessary
tools needed.dowel rod: for making the cross bars of the frame
tools needed.mallet: for tapping the chisels and driving the screws
tools needed.screws: to attach the dowel rod to the base and top pieces
tools needed.wood glue: to secure the joints between the pieces

warping board.description: a flat wooden board used for preparing the warp threads before weaving
warping board.name: warping board

related objects.loom: a device used for weaving fabric or thread
related objects.spindle: a small, rotating object with a pointed end used for spinning fibers into yarn

variants.large warping board: designed for larger pieces of fabric
variants.vertical warping board: has pegs along the edges to hold the threads in place

base.description: the flat bottom surface of the whetstone used for stability during sharpening

body.description: the rough surface of the stone used for sharpening blades

grit size.description: the size and coarseness of the abrasive particles on the surface of the stone, measured in micrometers or mesh count

oil groove.description: a shallow channel cut into the body to hold oil or water during sharpening

tools needed.grinding wheel: for shaping and smoothing the surface of the whetstone
tools needed.hone: to further refine the edge of the whetstone and create a consistent angle
tools needed.leather strap: for holding the whetstone securely while using it, but not strictly necessary
tools needed.oil stone: for lubricating the blade while sharpening it on the whetstone

whetstone.description: a stone used for sharpening blades
whetstone.name: whetstone

related objects.oil stone: a fine-grained sandstone used for honing edges

variants.coarse whetstone: used for shaping and roughening the edge of a blade
variants.fine whetstone: used for polishing and finishing the edge of a blade
variants.honesuckle stone: a type of fine-grained sandstone that is used to hone edges without removing metal

bevel.description: an angled edge on the bottom of the blade used for creating curves and beveled edges in the wood

blade.description: the cutting edge of the chisel made from high-carbon steel

ferrule.description: a metal collar that joins the blade to the handle, providing strength and durability

flute.description: a groove or channel along the length of the blade used for removing waste material and improving chip flow

handle.description: a wooden or plastic handle used for gripping and controlling the chisel

tools needed.file: to sharpen the blade if necessary and to remove any burrs or imperfections.
tools needed.hammer: to drive the punches into the tang of the blade, securing it to the handle
tools needed.rasp: for shaping or smoothing the blade if necessary
tools needed.vise: for holding the chisel steady when working on it, but not strictly necessary

wood carver's chisel.description: a tool used by woodworkers to create intricate designs in wood
wood carver's chisel.name: wood carver's chisel

related objects.gouge: a curved blade used for shaping or carving wood

variants.chisel with different shapes: has a variety of shapes such as round, flat, and v-shaped to create different designs in wood
variants.chisel with multiple edges: has several cutting edges on one tool for faster and more efficient work
variants.chisel with serrated edges: has teeth along the edge for sawing through wood fibers
